info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:58AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Norton, northeastern Decatur and Red Willow Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 457 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of McCook to near Danbury to 9 miles east of Oberlin. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Danbury around 505 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Norcatur, Lebanon and Indianola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
